=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: And Then There Were None
Review Date: 2018/08/23
Store: Aidan Turner  (Actor),     Maeve Dermody  (Actor),     Craig Viveiros  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD
Product Description: ['As the world teeters on the brink of World War II, 10 strangers are invited to isolated Soldier Island. Among them are young secretary Vera Claythorne (Maeve Dermody, Serangoon Road), soldier Philip Lombard (Aidan Turner, Poldark), General John MacArther (Sam Neill, Jurassic Park), spinster Emily Brent (Miranda Richardson, Parade’s End), and Judge Lawrence Wargrave (Charles Dance, Game of Thrones). With seemingly nothing in common, the guests wonder who their mysterious host may be. But the ominous reason for their visit soon becomes clear…and by the end of the night, the first of them is dead.Based on the bestselling crime novel of all time by Agatha Christie, this “TV event of the year” (The Guardian, UK) boasts an all-star cast also including Anna Maxwell Martin (The Bletchley Circle), Toby Stephens (Black Sails), Burn Gorman (TURN: Washington’s Spies), Noah Taylor (Peaky Blinders), and Douglas Booth (Great Expectations).']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Television/British Television, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Widescreen, Dolby, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Catherine Bailey, Toby Stephens, Douglas Booth, Burn Gorman, Craig Viveiros, Maeve Dermody, Noah Taylor, Anna Maxwell Martin, Charles Dance, Aidan Turner, Miranda Richardson, Sam NeillCatherine Bailey, Toby Stephens, Douglas Booth, Burn Gorman, Craig Viveiros, Maeve Dermody, Noah Taylor, Anna Maxwell Martin, Charles Dance, Aidan Turner, Miranda Richardson, Sam Neill   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Item model number': '35273635', 'Director': 'Craig Viveiros', 'Media Format': 'Widescreen, Dolby, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 57 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 19, 2016', 'Actors': 'Aidan Turner, Maeve Dermody, Charles Dance, Miranda Richardson, Toby Stephens', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: This is the best version of And then There Were None.  Perfectly cast.
Review Title: Wonderful movie!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Being Human: Season 2
Review Date: 2018/11/02
Store: Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Being Human', 'returns for a gripping second season as vampire Mitchell (Aidan Turner), werewolf George (Russell Tovey), and ghost Annie (Lenora Crichlow) encounter new enemies in their fight to lead something close to normal lives. It’s tough being supernatural. Mitchell’s romance with a feisty doctor is disrupted by a vampire community in disarray. George’s relationship with a new girlfriend is undermined by an uncontrollable twist in his werewolf existence. Annie has a brutal reminder that life as a spirit is full of challenges. All three are threatened by CenSSA, a religious organization committed to the destruction or conversion of supernatural freaks, operated by the mysterious Professor Jaggat and the sinister, cold-hearted Kemp. Just when your inner demons might be conquered, it’s the outer demons who won’t go away.', 'Amazon.com', 'Fans will pounce on the second season of', 'Being Human', ", the beloved series about a trio of supernatural beings--a vampire, a werewolf, and a ghost--who just want to lead normal lives. In the first episode, George (the lycanthrope, played by Russell Tovey) is trying to make his relationship with Nina (Sinead Keenan) work, only he doesn't know that he's passed his curse on to her; rakishly handsome Mitchell (the bloodsucker, Adrian Turner) meets a new doctor at the hospital and feels an immediate attraction; and ever-chipper Annie (the specter, Lenora Crichlow) sets out to get a job. Unfortunately for them, a gaunt fanatic named Kemp wants to destroy them and all their kind. The series seeks to juggle domestic story lines about relationships and family with grand conspiracies and bloody murders. The result never meshes--in one scene, Mitchell conspires with a police chief to cover up vampire murders, and in another he, George, and Annie are flopped on the couch, chatting like college freshmen about having sex. Either sequence could be enjoyable, but trying to slam them together undercuts both. It doesn't help that the characters squeal and whine like sullen teenagers half the time. Fortunately, the cast manages to rise above the writing to exude genuine charm and the production values are strong--the designers clearly relish every opportunity for gruesomeness.", 'Being Human: Season Two', "has only a small handful of extras, but there are eight episodes instead of the first season's six.", '--Bret Fetzer']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Documentary', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.55 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '5 hours and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 21, 2010', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'BBC Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '3'}
Review Text: A fun watch
Review Title: Great TV series
Rating: 5.0

=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Masterpiece: Poldark Season 2 (UK Edition) Blu-ray
Review Date: 2020/05/22
Store: Aidan Turner  (Actor),     n/a  (Director)    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, TV
Product Description: ['After fighting in the American Revolutionary War, Englishman Ross Poldark (Aidan Turner) returns to his Cornwall home only to find his father dead, his community in the grip of harsh economic times, and the woman he loves engaged to his cousin. Resolved to make a fresh start, Poldark takes control of his lands and sets out to redefine his fortunes. This newest, British-made series adapted from the Winston Graham novels co-stars Heida Reed, Kyle Soller, and Elinor Tomlinson.10 episodes on 3 discs. 10 hrs. Widescreen; Soundtrack: English.']

Product Title: Love is Blind
Review Date: 2020/05/22
Store: Andy Delaney  (Director),     Monty Whitebloom  (Director),     Matthew Broderick  (Actor),     Chloë Sevigny  (Actor)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
Product Description: ["A young woman is unable to see or hear her mother despite living with her in the same house. With the help of an eccentric psychiatrist she learns to grow up and take control of her future despite not being able to see what's in front of her. Starring Aidan Turner (Poldark), Chloë Sevigny (American Horror Story) and Matthew Broderick (Ferris Bueller's Day Off). A must watch!"]

Product Description: ['As the world teeters on the brink of World War II, 10 strangers are invited to isolated Soldier Island. Among them are young secretary Vera Claythorne (Maeve Dermody, Serangoon Road), soldier Philip Lombard (Aidan Turner, Poldark), General John MacArther (Sam Neill, Jurassic Park), spinster Emily Brent (Miranda Richardson, Parade’s End), and Judge Lawrence Wargrave (Charles Dance, Game of Thrones). With seemingly nothing in common, the guests wonder who their mysterious host may be. But the ominous reason for their visit soon becomes clear…and by the end of the night, the first of them is dead.Based on the bestselling crime novel of all time by Agatha Christie, this “TV event of the year” (The Guardian, UK) boasts an all-star cast also including Anna Maxwell Martin (The Bletchley Circle), Toby Stephens (Black Sails), Burn Gorman (TURN: Washington’s Spies), Noah Taylor (Peaky Blinders), and Douglas Booth (Great Expectations).']

Product Title: Being Human: Season 2
Review Date: 2018/11/02
Store: Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Being Human', 'returns for a gripping second season as vampire Mitchell (Aidan Turner), werewolf George (Russell Tovey), and ghost Annie (Lenora Crichlow) encounter new enemies in their fight to lead something close to normal lives. It’s tough being supernatural. Mitchell’s romance with a feisty doctor is disrupted by a vampire community in disarray. George’s relationship with a new girlfriend is undermined by an uncontrollable twist in his werewolf existence. Annie has a brutal reminder that life as a spirit is full of challenges. All three are threatened by CenSSA, a religious organization committed to the destruction or conversion of supernatural freaks, operated by the mysterious Professor Jaggat and the sinister, cold-hearted Kemp. Just when your inner demons might be conquered, it’s the outer demons who won’t go away.', 'Amazon.com', 'Fans will pounce on the second season of', 'Being Human', ", the beloved series about a trio of supernatural beings--a vampire, a werewolf, and a ghost--who just want to lead normal lives. In the first episode, George (the lycanthrope, played by Russell Tovey) is trying to make his relationship with Nina (Sinead Keenan) work, only he doesn't know that he's passed his curse on to her; rakishly handsome Mitchell (the bloodsucker, Adrian Turner) meets a new doctor at the hospital and feels an immediate attraction; and ever-chipper Annie (the specter, Lenora Crichlow) sets out to get a job. Unfortunately for them, a gaunt fanatic named Kemp wants to destroy them and all their kind. The series seeks to juggle domestic story lines about relationships and family with grand conspiracies and bloody murders. The result never meshes--in one scene, Mitchell conspires with a police chief to cover up vampire murders, and in another he, George, and Annie are flopped on the couch, chatting like college freshmen about having sex. Either sequence could be enjoyable, but trying to slam them together undercuts both. It doesn't help that the characters squeal and whine like sullen teenagers half the time. Fortunately, the cast manages to rise above the writing to exude genuine charm and the production values are strong--the designers clearly relish every opportunity for gruesomeness.", 'Being Human: Season Two', "has only a small handful of extras, but there are eight episodes instead of the first season's six.", '--Bret Fetzer']
Average Rating: 4.7

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual demonstrates a clear affinity for action-adventure and drama genres, highlighted by a consistent pattern of higher ratings (4.3 to 5.0) for both traditional and contemporary productions. Their interest in mythological and heroic narratives, coupled with keen attention to actors like Aidan Turner, suggests a preference for engaging storylines that often feature historical or supernatural elements.

Notable themes across purchases include an attraction to ensemble casts and character-driven plots, emphasizing immersive narratives and character development. The user seems to favor quality over quantity, with an inclination towards well-reviewed releases, as evidenced by their strong ratings for intelligently crafted storytelling.

In terms of quality, they lean towards higher production values reflected in choices of formats like Blu-ray and DVD, ensuring a visually engaging experience. However, they remain moderately price-sensitive, often opting for collections or seasons rather than standalone premium releases, which aligns with the diverse range of products engaged.

Overall, their core preferences affirm a penchant for engaging, character-centric narratives within the realms of action-adventure and drama, marked by notable actors and strong production quality, while also maintaining a slight sensitivity to pricing, favoring accessible over exclusive offerings.
